techmeme.title: Darktrace co-founder Poppy Gustafsson, who left last month ahead of the £4.3B takeover of the cybersecurity group, is appointed as the UK's investment minister (Financial Times)
PayPal formally launches PayPal Ads, which looks to help US marketers tap into data about transactions across PayPal's platforms, including Venmo and Honey (Lara O'Reilly/Business Insider)
Sources detail Meta's work on a consumer version of Orion, which could be built within two years, plans to bring Orion wristband tech to its other devices, more (CNBC)
Stripe reintegrates crypto payments in the US, letting users pay merchants in USDC or USDP on Ethereum, Solana, and Polygon, after disabling the feature in 2018 (Jack Kubinec/Blockworks)
The US and UK announce a joint agreement aimed at keeping children safer online, including the setting up of an online safety working group to share expertise (BBC)
